citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An expired bottle of dewormer (Cydectin exp 5-2025) was in storage and per representatives had been used for some
pigs this morning. Expired medications might not be effective as intended or might not be safe. Ensure that expired
medications are not given to animals.
***Correct from 9/11/2025 forward.

Enclosures with wading/aquatic birds lacked a pool/aquatic area. Aquatic areas are a special space requirement for
wading and aquatic birds and give them the benefit of expressing species-typical behaviors. Ensure that primary
enclosures for the wading/aquatic birds housed at the facility contain a pool or other aquatic area as required.
***I observed facility personnel adquired materials and began to add aquatic spaces prior to leaving the facility. Ensure
maintained corrected by 9/13/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
LYNNE WHITE-SHIM, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An expired bottle of dewormer (Cydectin exp 5-2025) was in storage and per representatives had been used for some 
pigs this morning. Expired medications might not be effective as intended or might not be safe. Ensure that expired 
medications are not given to animals.  
***Correct from 9/11/2025 forward. 
3.153(c) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Enclosures with wading/aquatic birds lacked a pool/aquatic area. Aquatic areas are a special space requirement for 
wading and aquatic birds and give them the benefit of expressing species-typical behaviors. Ensure that primary 
enclosures for the wading/aquatic birds housed at the facility contain a pool or other aquatic area as required.  
***I observed facility personnel adquired materials and began to add aquatic spaces prior to leaving the facility. Ensure 
maintained corrected by 9/13/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
LYNNE WHITE-SHIM, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
